com.aevi.configuration

Class TerminalConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aevi.helpers.BundleWrapper
      • com.aevi.configuration.TerminalConfiguration

  • public class TerminalConfiguration
extends BundleWrapper
    The TerminalConfiguration class can be used to obtain configuration information about the terminal, such as API version and terminal Id. The getTerminalConfiguration(android.content.Context) method can be used to obtain an instance. An Android Context object must be passed in, so usually it's best to query the configuration from inside an activity. For example: 

     
 TerminalConfiguration configuration = TerminalConfiguration.getTerminalConfiguration(this)

      • getTerminalConfiguration

        public static TerminalConfiguration getTerminalConfiguration(android.content.Context context)
        Get the terminal configuration.
        Parameters:
        context - Android Context object.
        Returns:
        terminal configuration object.
        Throws:
        CompatibilityException - if version of installed service is incompatible with the application SDK version

      • isTerminalServicesInstalled

        public static boolean isTerminalServicesInstalled(android.content.Context context)
        Checks if the TerminalServices is installed correctly. On a generic tablet this will return false if the Device Simulator is not installed OR it was installed after the application was installed. This can be solved a generic tablet by uninstalling and reinstalling the application.
        Parameters:
        context - Android Context object
        Returns:
        true if installed correctly

      • getServiceStatus

        public static ServiceState getServiceStatus(java.lang.Class<? extends AeviService> serviceClass,
                            android.content.Context context)
        Returns the status of the given service. The caller must request the {Permissions.Configuration} permission for this call to execute.
        Parameters:
        context - Android Context object
        Returns:
        {ServiceState} of the Payment application or simulator.
